tv.source-info-name: Pluto TV Space guide by TV

programme.title: The New Frontier: Tickets Please
programme.desc: No spacecraft have traveled so fast or so close to a star before. It is hoped to reveal the source of the solar winds that effect us here on Earth

programme.title: The New Frontier: The Astronauts
programme.desc: One hundred kilometres above the Earth’s surface lies an invisible frontier: the edge of space.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Mercury Or Bust
programme.desc: The ESA - JAXA joint Bepi-Colombo Mission is moments away from launch.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Gravity
programme.desc: Gravity has long been a force that has intrigued scientists. Now, for the first time scientists are probing to detect gravity waves in space as well as mapping the gravity patterns of the moon.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Silent Partner
programme.desc: Although we have put man on the moon, our silent partner still holds many mysteries. What haven't we seen? What haven't we discovered?

programme.title: The New Frontier: WEBB OF LIFE
programme.desc: The James Webb Space Telescope is now operational. Launched aboard an Arianne 5 the 10-billion-dollar spacecraft has deployed successfully and reached its orbit around the Sun.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Stars Above
programme.desc: Stars are a bit like human beings. They can be warm or cold, they come in all kinds of shapes and sizes.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Invasion on Mars
programme.desc: The EXO Mars and Curiosity continue their scientific discoveries as we prepare new missions both robotic and manned to the Red planet Mars.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Landing on Mars
programme.desc: Mars sparks our curiosity like no other planet because it is so reachable. Despite having landed there, most of the information we gather is still done by instruments in the planet's orbit.

programme.title: The New Frontier: The Ice Giants
programme.desc: Beyond the asteroid belt lay the ice giants, some can be seen with the naked eye, others only glimpsed once by a passing probe.

programme.title: The New Frontier: From There To Here
programme.desc: Series introduction and the study of Earth from orbit.

programme.title: EARTH´S EVIL TWIN
programme.desc: Venus is a planet closest to Earth in distance and size, it once may have been as hospitable to life as Earth is now. Then something changed and Venus became shrouded in hot dense toxic clouds.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Next Stop Mars
programme.desc: It has fired our imaginations for millennia, Mars, the God of War and the source of Man's science fictional demise.

programme.title: Spacetime: Destination Mars - From the moon to the red planet
programme.desc: Mankind is entering a new era of space travel. Astronauts are set to return to the moon before the decade is out. And scientists and visionaries say: humans will soon set foot on a foreign planet for the first time: Mars.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Exo Planeta
programme.desc: As scientists and astronomers peer closer at nearby stars with ever more fidelity they are discovering planets; exo planets, worlds outside our own solar system.

programme.title: The Fabric of the Cosmos: The Illusion of Time
programme.desc: Brian Greene takes us on the ultimate time traveling adventure, hurtling 50 years into the future before stepping into a wormhole to travel back to Big Bang.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Hyabusa
programme.desc: The Japanese Asteroid sample return mission has reached its target and is surveying the space rock ready to dip down and take a sample.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Mars: Red Dawn
programme.desc: Landing a spacecraft on Mars is no easy task given our limited knowledge of the planet. The difference between success and failure can rely on the most minute detail.

programme.title: Spacetime: The Dark Side - Black holes and invisible matter
programme.desc: We are surrounded by dark matter and dark energy. Mysterious forces that permeate the universe and play a fundamental role in determining its evolution. Scientists can observe the effects of these cosmic enigmas. But as yet, they have found nothing.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Shooting Gallery: Asteroids and Comets
programme.desc: Scientist long thought that our solar system consisted of the sun, the planets, and their moons. We soon found that we are far from alone, often coming into contact with asteroids, comets, and other debris.

programme.title: RISING TIDES
programme.desc: The next generation of Earth observation satellites are now in place maintaining the continuity of long-term climate data, in particular the planets rising temperatures and related ocean levels.

programme.title: The New Frontier: THE NEXT BIG LEAPS
programme.desc: Projects in the works. SunRISE, SPHEREx, NEOS and others, their mission to expand our knowledge of Earth, the surrounding space, Dark Matter, and the earliest galaxies. N

programme.title: The New Frontier: Mars: Adapt Or Leave
programme.desc: As the latest successes and failures come and go Mars continues to give up her secrets.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: The Big Bang
programme.desc: Throughout history, our nightly view of the universe has fueled our collective imagination. When it comes to the Big Bang, not even the most creative work of imagination can rival what science has revealed about the birth of the universe.

programme.title: The Fabric of the Cosmos: What Is Space?
programme.desc: Brian Greene reveals space as a dynamic fabric that can stretch, twist, warp, and ripple under the influence of gravity, and explores dark energy, which makes up 70% of the universe.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Water Worlds
programme.desc: The key ingredient to life in the universe is water. Until recently we thought Earth was the only place in the solar system to have any water at all. Now that probes are peering around nearby worlds we are finding that is just not the case.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Fermi Paradox
programme.desc: The Fermi Paradox asks the ultimate question: Given a few reasonable assumptions about the chance of life arising elsewhere in the universe and the distance between the stars, why has an alien civilization not presented itself?

programme.title: In the Shadow of the Moon
programme.desc: Between 1968 and 1972, the world watched in awe each time an American spacecraft voyaged to the Moon. Only 12 men walked upon its surface and they remain the only human beings to have stood on another world.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Mercury Advances - America's first manned space program finally puts a man in orbit. Camera Tracking - The array of special cameras that follow a spacecraft at launch. The International Space Station - The building and operation.
